qas.question: The British Royal Navy blockaded which ports?
Where did the British Royal Navy defeat the French and Spanish in 1805?
When were the Netherlands' colonies annexed by Napoleon?
The Napoleonic peace treaty had Ceylon given to which country?

context: The Napoleonic Wars were therefore ones in which Britain invested large amounts of capital and resources to win. <a0_0>French<a0_0/> ports were blockaded by the Royal Navy, which won a decisive victory over a Franco-Spanish fleet at <a1_0>Trafalgar<a1_0/> in 1805. Overseas colonies were attacked and occupied, including those of the Netherlands, which was annexed by Napoleon in <a2_0>1810<a2_0/>. France was finally defeated by a coalition of European armies in <a3_0>1815<a3_0/>. Britain was again the beneficiary of peace treaties: France ceded the Ionian Islands, Malta (which it had occupied in 1797 and 1798 respectively), Mauritius, St Lucia, and Tobago; Spain ceded Trinidad; the Netherlands Guyana, and the Cape Colony. <a4_0>Britain<a4_0/> returned Guadeloupe, Martinique, French Guiana, and Réunion to France, and Java and Suriname to the Netherlands, while gaining control of Ceylon (1795–1815).
